page.title: 05St. Bartholomew's Church
page.content: The area has two churches, both of the Anglican tradition.Saint Bartholomews built in 1850 is on the west side of the village of Wickham Bishops. The church tower is 120ft. high and topped with a spire. The building is constructed of kentish rag and caen stone and cost its donor Miss Sarah Leigh Â£4000. In 1985 there are about 125 members on the electoral roll. Three services are held every Sunday. There is a Sunday School and a young people's fellowship. A mid-week womens Christian fellowship meets in two groups and is ecumenical in nature as there is no church other than the Anglican in the village. The church hall houses a nursery school which meets daily.
